pageContext.title: A lady, formerly called Catherine, Countess of Suffolk (1566 - 1633)
pageContext.sitter_text: A lady, formerly called Catherine, Countess of Suffolk (1566 - 1633)
pageContext.description_physical:
The palette identified is consistent with the materials and technique employed by Oliver.
'Infelix Spectator' written in gold on the background. 
The UV image shows retouched areas on the ruff: they appear greenish due to the use of zinc white and in contrast to the orange UV fluorescence colour given by lead white, employed by the artist. Parts of the background, especially around the edges, are also retouched, as they appear greenish or blue in comparison to the background, which does not give any UV fluorescence colour and is therefore dark.
pageContext.pigments_costume: Ruff: lead white, indigo (grey shading); dress: bone black, lead white
pageContext.pigments_flesh_tones_and_lips: Skin: lead white, red lead; lips: red lead, pink lake
pageContext.pigments_hair_and_beard: Hair: earth pigments, lead white, carbon black
pageContext.pigments_jewellery: Pearls: lead white, silver; gold earring
pageContext.Credit: By kind permission of the Duke of Buccleuch
